intro: Neuroloma ajanense, commonly known as the Ajané tree, is a tropical plant native to parts of South America. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in panicles, and it produces woody fruits containing seeds. The tree is valued for its timber and has some traditional medicinal uses.
